name: Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
spread_transmission: Whiteflies transmit the virus while feeding on plant sap.
prevention: Control whitefly populations with insecticides or barriers.
treatment: Remove and dispose of infected plants.
impact: Reduces yield and affects fruit quality.
seasonal_occurrence: Common in warmer seasons with high whitefly activity.

name: Bacterial Spot
causes: Spread by bacteria infecting leaves and fruit.
symptoms: Small dark spots on leaves, often with a yellow halo.
spread_transmission: Spreads through water, soil, and contaminated tools.
prevention: Avoid overhead watering and disinfect tools.
impact: Affects plant health and reduces yield.

name: Early Blight
symptoms: Dark spots with concentric rings on leaves.
spread_transmission: Spores spread through wind, rain, and soil.
prevention: Rotate crops and avoid overhead watering.
impact: Reduces plant vigor and fruit yield.
seasonal_occurrence: Most common in warm, wet weather.

name: Leaf Mold
symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces, leading to mold on undersides.
spread_transmission: Spread by air in high humidity conditions.
prevention: Increase ventilation and avoid overcrowding plants.
treatment: Use fungicides and improve airflow around plants.
impact: Reduces photosynthesis and overall plant health.
seasonal_occurrence: Most common in cool, damp weather.

name: Septoria Leaf Spot
symptoms: Small, circular spots with dark centers on leaves.
spread_transmission: Spread by water, soil, and infected seeds.
prevention: Use disease-free seeds and maintain plant spacing.
treatment: Apply fungicides and remove infected leaves.

name: Target Spot
symptoms: Dark spots with target-like rings on leaves.
spread_transmission: Spores spread by wind, water, and soil.
prevention: Avoid overhead irrigation and remove infected leaves.
treatment: Apply fungicides and remove diseased parts.

name: Two-Spotted Spider Mite Spot
causes: Caused by spider mites feeding on the plant.
spread_transmission: Spread by contact with other plants and wind.
prevention: Increase humidity and introduce natural predators.
treatment: Use miticides and keep plant environment moist.
seasonal_occurrence: Most common in hot, dry conditions.

name: Mosaic Virus
causes: Spread by aphids and contact with infected plants.
symptoms: Mottled patterns on leaves, often with a yellow mosaic appearance.
spread_transmission: Transmitted by insects or through contaminated tools.
prevention: Use resistant varieties and control aphid populations.
impact: Stunts plant growth and affects fruit production.

name: Late Blight
causes: Caused by a water mold in wet conditions.
symptoms: Large, dark spots on leaves and fruit.
spread_transmission: Spores spread by wind and water.
prevention: Avoid overhead watering and remove infected plants.
impact: Can destroy entire crops if untreated.
seasonal_occurrence: Most common in cool, wet weather.
